law.catch_line: Release of information to consumer reporting agencies -- Notice -- Charge for information.

text.section: The cabinet shall periodically make information available to consumer reporting agencies regarding the amount of overdue support owed by a parent. Amounts may be reported by the cabinet to the certified consumer reporting agency.

The cabinet shall provide advance notice to the obligor concerning the proposed release of the information to the certified consumer reporting agency and inform the obligor of the methods available to contest the accuracy of the information in compliance with due process of law.
The cabinet may charge the certified consumer reporting agency a fee not to exceed the actual cost of providing the information.

law.history: Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 255, sec. 11, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 411, sec. 11, effective July 15, 1988. -- Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 487, sec. 8, effective July 15, 1986.
